sub_title: Independent Business Owner at Blokland Advisory Services
summary:
BAS is an independant consultant in the governance and management of water supply and sanitation systems with a focus on institutional and managerial options, strategy and structure, performance and benchmarking, services provision to the poor, inclusive project development, innovative investment financing and capacity development. 

I have experience in developing and implementing projects with water utilities and knowledge institutes in one or several of the above focal areas. Also, I have been engaged in the monitoring, review and evaluation of water and sanitation projects. I taught professional and postgraduate courses in water services management. I researched and published on water utility management models, performance assessment and capacity building for water utilities and on benchmarking for pro-poor water services provision.

I have a Master Degree in Civil Engineering from the Technical University of Delft and have worked in the water supply and sanitation sector since 1975. My work took me to more than 40 developing and newly industrialized countries. I was Associate Professor in Water Services Management at UNESCO-IHE until my retirement in 2014. I also served in several management functions including those of Head of Department, Vice-Rector Education, Deputy Director and Acting Director. Prior to joining UNESCO-IHE in 1984, I worked 4 years with IWACO, a consulting engineering firm and 5 years with the Water and Sewerage Board in Swaziland.  

I was a Governor of the World Water Council, Member of the Bureau and Chairman of its Commission on Legal and Financial Affairs, Co-ordinator of the Institutional and Managerial Options Working Group of the Water Supply and Sanitation Collaborative Council, Member of the GWP Nominations Advisory Committee, Member of the Management Team of the UNDP-associated Cap-Net Project, and Member of Board of Delft Cluster, a virtual research organisation composed of seven applied research institutes in the Netherlands.

projects.title: Water Finance Facility
projects.description: The Water Finance Facility (WFF) is located in Amsterdam and is active in Kenya through the Kenya Pooled Water Fund (KPWF). In my role as WFF's Lead Consultant Utility and Project Development, I lead a team of experts that are responsible for co-developing bankable capital investment projects with pre-selected, creditworthy Kenyan water utilities (WSPs). Fourteen WSPs indicated an interest to develop US$ 60 million worth of projects. The first portfolio of US$ 30 million includes water, sanitation and efficiency improvement projects for 6 water services providers reaching out to about 750,000 people of which 25% in urban Low-income areas. These projects went through phases of conceptualisation, feasibility and detailed design. In 2021, the plan to issue a green bond in the local capital market for financing the portfolio of investments did not materialize and activities came to a standstill. Two follow-up activities are now ongoing, i.e., an activity to assist WSPs to access commercial financing for the investment projects, and a study to investigate how if and how capital market financing of WSP investments can be taken up.

contributors.headline: Independent Business Owner at Blokland Advisory Services

projects.title: End of Term Review WaterWorX
projects.description:
The WaterWorX Program started in 2017 and aims to provide water services to an additional 10 million people by 2030. The program is executed in 3 phases, and is implemented and funded by a consortium that includes all 10 Dutch water supply companies and the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA). The program is targeted at water utilities in developing countries, through Water Operators Partnerships (WOPs) that these utilities have with their Dutch counterparts. The programme now covers 26 WOPs in 18 countries.
The End of Term Review covers the period 2017-2020 (Phase I) and is tasked to review and analyse progress to date and formulate recommendations for Phase II. The review covers all WOPs/countries, with field level investigations in 6 countries. The assignment was contracted to MDF consultants by MFA. I am heading the team of 5 central and 6 local consultants, and take care of three Work Packages, i.e. People and Organisation (#1) and Performance improvement (#2) that are directed at the utilities, and Coordination and Knowledge Management (#5) that is program-wide.

contributors.headline: Independent Business Owner at Blokland Advisory Services

projects.title: Comparative study on Water supply to Low Income Areas in Dhaka, Bangladesh
projects.description:
UNICEF estimates that across Dhaka, 4 million people live in 5,000 slums. Since 2010, the Dhaka Water and Sewerage Authority (DWASA), assisted by local and international NGOs is carrying out a commitment to supply the slum dwellers with legal water services by extending its networks into the slums. The Water Operators Partnership of DWASA and VEI also contributes to this effort with a target to provide WASH services to 60,000 slum dwellers.
This project compares seven different models for water services provision to the slums that are in operation, in an effort to learn about their development and operational performance, assess longer term sustainability and formulate recommendations directed at DWASA, the NGOs, development partners and others. The study was commissioned by VEI bv and is being implemented by LightCastle Partners. My role is to assist the study and to ensure its quality and indepence.

contributors.headline: Independent Business Owner at Blokland Advisory Services

projects.title: Water from Hill lakes for local economic development, Lebanon
projects.description: Preparation of a feasibility study for the improved utilization of and the conveyance of water from artificial Hill Lakes to villages and farmlands in the area of the Deir El Ahmar Union of Municipalities. The recommended investments focus on improving water quality, extending water distribution systems in three Hill lake areas and also include a demonstration farm to promote innovative and more sustainable water use, farming methods and crops. The proposed investments were implemented since and more water is now available in the dry season, thus prolonging the growing season and boosting economic development. In 2021, I developed a capacity building programme for the municipality on operating and maintaining the hill lakes system and for the farmers on alternative crops and drip irrigation.

contributors.headline: Independent Business Owner at Blokland Advisory Services

projects.title: Capacity development and Maturity assessment, Chittagong, Bangladesh
projects.description: The Utility Modernization Umbrella Consultancy is an institutional development program for the Chittagong Water and Sanitation Authority (CWASA) that aims to develop the capacity of CWASA in the operation and management of its services, and support the modernization of its operational structure, systems and processes. The project was carried out by the National Water and Sewerage Corporation of Uganda, and I was a subcontractor. My task as Lead, Capacity Development and Maturity assessment was to assess the effectiveness of the organisation by means of a ‘maturity’ assessment and to develop and supervise the capacity development programme to address the identified deficiencies in the organisation and its staff.

contributors.headline: Independent Business Owner at Blokland Advisory Services

projects.title: Mid term review Water Operators Partnership, Dhaka, Bangladesh
projects.description: Mid-term review (MTR) of two consecutive phases of a Water Operators Partnership (WOPs) with a value of US$ 7.3. million (2013-2017) and US$ 4.1 million (2017-2021) between the Dhaka Water and Sanitation Authority and Dutch VEI b.v. in the area of water supply and sanitation. These MTRs, conducted in 2015 and 2019 reviewed objectives, KPIs, methodology, activities, achievements and expenditures of the WOP and recommended adjustments, if and where deemed required. These WOPs focus on deep borewell construction and operation, distribution systems management, efficiency improvement, the introduction of SCADA and the provision of services to Low-Income Communities.

contributors.headline: Independent Business Owner at Blokland Advisory Services

projects.title: Mid Term Review, Global Water Operators Partnership Alliance
projects.description: The objective of the Global Water Operators Partnership Alliance (GWOPA) is to upscale partnerships between water services providers to help countries reach SDG#6.  The Mid Term Review (MTR) of GWOPA’s 2013-2017 Strategy that I conducted found that GWOPA has a visible global presence, has increased awareness, funding and credibility for the WOPs practice, established strong regional platforms and a growing implementation capacity, and is facilitating a number of WOPs directly. The MTR also identified challenges and recommended the positioning of WOPs as a strategic instrument for building and sustaining water services provider capacity and investments; the need for ‘proof of the WOP concept’; the lobbying of financiers; and the positioning of GWOPA/WOPs as a tested instrument for realizing the SDG#6 commitments.

authors.headline: Independent Business Owner at Blokland Advisory Services

profile_positions.description: Blokland Advisory Services (BAS) is an independant consultant based in Delft. BAS provides advisory services in the domains of governance, management and operation of drinking water supply and sanitation, with a focus on improving access and enhancing the quality of services delivery. BAS assists lenders, governments and operators in the areas of performance analysis, identification of capacity gaps, the development and implementation of capacity development programs, and the monitoring and evaluation of capacity development, performance improvement and partnership programmes
profile_positions.title: Independent Business Owner

profile_positions.description: Water Partner Foundation is a non-profit organisation that aims to increase global dissemination of knowledge and experiences in good governance, financing and sustainable management of the world’s water resources and the environment. The mission of Water Partner is to initiate, stimulate and support projects and programmes through bringing together good governance, water management and financing expertise
